meanings.definition: To attribute or assign (something) to a particular cause or source.
meanings.sent1: She ascribes her success to hard work and determination.
meanings.sent2: The detective ascribes the crime to the notorious gang in town.
meanings.sent3: The cat ascribes the missing fish to the sneaky mouse.
meanings.sent4: His teacher ascribes his improvement in grades to his newfound study habits.
meanings.sent5: The farmer ascribes the bountiful harvest to the fertile soil.

meanings.definition: To regard or represent (something) as being caused by or coming from a specified source.
meanings.sent1: He ascribes the strange noise to the old house settling.
meanings.sent2: The ancient legend ascribes the creation of the world to a powerful deity.
meanings.sent3: The child ascribes the mysterious shadows to playful ghosts.
meanings.sent4: The artist ascribes the inspiration for the painting to a vivid dream.
meanings.sent5: The scientist ascribes the unusual phenomenon to a rare planetary alignment.

meanings.definition: To credit or assign (a work or an achievement) to a particular person or group.
meanings.sent1: The author ascribes the bestseller to her dedicated writing team.
meanings.sent2: Historians ascribe the invention of the printing press to Johannes Gutenberg.
meanings.sent3: The coach ascribes the team's victory to their strong teamwork.
meanings.sent4: The company ascribes its success to the innovative ideas of its employees.
meanings.sent5: The teacher ascribes the outstanding performance to the students' hard work and dedication.
